forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. Southeast wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a high near 56. Southeast wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
A veil of rain cloaks Downtown San Francisco this morning, as the city rests beneath a heavy blanket of clouds. Grays dominate the skyline, with the low hum of precipitation whispering against windows and sidewalks alike. The temperature hovers in the cool embrace of fifty-one degrees, inviting a retreat into the warmth of layers. The winds, gentle yet persistent from the southeast, add an edge to the dampness, with sporadic gusts ruffling hair and jackets as rain promises to linger throughout the day.

Looking ahead, Monday is set to unfold in a similar manner, with forecasted precipitation bringing a steady rhythm of droplets and a high near fifty-six. Given the morning’s overcast skies and the likelihood of continued rain, this day holds the essence of a quiet sanctuary, perfect for curling up with a book in a cozy café or exploring the serene, rain-kissed parks where the colors of nature are deepened by the moisture. Dressing warmly, with a waterproof coat and sturdy boots, will ensure comfort as Pacific fog rolls in, blending with the light mist. While the Golden Gate Bridge may hide behind its curtain of fog, there's a certain romance in the air, inviting one to find solace in the simple, quiet pleasures of the day.
